Field Label: Unique identifier for a spiked (contrived) sample
Unique identifier for a grouping of samples or runs
RADx-rad Study ID; Subject ID; Datavent ID
Identifier for groups of patients
Unique name or identifier for biosensor protocol
Abbreviation or short label for technology
Type of analyte(s) or target(s) to be detected
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: antigen|viral RNA|virus|antibody|human IgA|human RBD IgA|human IgG|human RBD IgG|human IgM|human RBD IM| neutralizing antibody|EV RNA | VOC

Field Label: Specimen type used in assay
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: breath | hand odor | plasma | saliva | skin

Field Label: Dilution of specimen before test
Measured result. If other, specify result in assay_result_other
Description of other assay result
Numerical assay readout
Unit of assay_readout
Description of assay readout type
Name of compound/metabolite detected
Chemical formula of compound
InChIKey of compound (unique identifier for data linking)
Concentation of compound
Retention time for a specific compound
Unit of voc compound retention time
Retention time for the second peak used if applicable
Decription of retention times used in calculation of data (one peak or two peaks)
Comments about the detection of compound
Field Note: example: probable compound based on retention time

Field Label: The relative abundance of a VOC in a sample.
Ratio of peak area of listed analyte to peak area of listed internal reference
Specific internal reference used for peak area ratios
Description of internal reference used
Unique identifer for the peak in a mass spectrum defined by the mass and retention time.
The most probable mass of the peak after the identification or mass-to-charge ratio (m/z) when not identified.
Field Note: g/mol when peak identified  and m/z when peak not identified . Example: 57.1

Field Label: Unit of peak_mass
The measure of time taken for a peak to pass through a chromatography column.
Unit of peak_retention_time
Retention time (no peak)
Unit of retention_time
Measured signal intensity
Field Note: example: signal intensity in a chromatogram

Field Label: The signal generated from the ionization of VOC seprated compounds
Unit of gc_amplitude
The time needed for a certain compound to pass through the GC column
Unit of gc_elution_time
